definition: to make an about-turn/to reverse one's direction, policy, sequence etc/to turn things on their head
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: This material inversion excites irregular, and as a consequence passionate, concern.
sentences.chinese: 物質的倒轉引起不正常，結果是激情的關心。

sentences.english: Maybe this is time, suddenly returning.
sentences.chinese: 也許這就是時間，突然倒轉。

sentences.english: But, I can't turn back time.
sentences.chinese: 可是我不能讓時光倒轉。

sentences.english: Those operations are called reverse repurchase agreements.
sentences.chinese: 一些被稱作倒轉的購買合同的業務操作。

sentences.english: There is a curious role reversal.
sentences.chinese: 現實中存在着古怪的角色倒轉。

sentences.english: The last geomagnetic reversal for Earth was about 780,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 地球上最後一次地磁倒轉大約是78萬年前。

sentences.english: Remove from oven and let cool. Then slice cake into 2 layers.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕出爐後即倒轉，待冷切開兩層留後用。

sentences.english: The war situation was inverted and the invaders were defeated.
sentences.chinese: 戰局倒轉了，入侵者被擊退。

sentences.english: He pressed the button and reversed the direction of movement of the machine.
sentences.chinese: 他按了一下按鈕，讓機器倒轉。

sentences.english: We get an overturned glyptodont in the far right lane.
sentences.chinese: 在右車道有一隻倒轉的雕齒獸。

sentences.english: E. g. We don't think it possible to set back the clock of history.
sentences.chinese: 我們認爲使歷史時針倒轉是不可能的。

sentences.english: There was no inverted vascular bundle developed in the bract scale of Thuja occidentals.
sentences.chinese: 崖柏屬雌球果的苞鱗中沒有倒轉的維管束形成。

sentences.english: Reverse the bit order of alternate blocks.
sentences.chinese: 每隔一個塊倒轉塊的位順序。

sentences.english: Three prosperous periods of conodont have relation to Palaeomagnetism Reversal.
sentences.chinese: 牙形石的三個繁盛期與古地磁極性倒轉有關。

sentences.english: When a copy is offered for sale, it is a major event in the stamp world.
sentences.chinese: 今天，一個“倒轉票”的拷貝出售都是集郵界的大事。

sentences.english: That day, he turned his gunpoint to himself.
sentences.chinese: 那一日他將槍口倒轉指向本身。

definition: to hang in the air/suspended in midair/(fig.) uncertain
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
to turn sth around/to swivel
pendulum
wheel/CL:個|个[ge4]
to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
to shake/to sway
lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
surname Yao
to shake/to rock/to row/to crank
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
to incline/to lean/to slant/to slope/to tilt
to provoke/to tease
to fly out
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
to align/(typography) to justify
concerted action/to collude (in dishonesty)
edge/fringe
